metadata.title: CVE-2021-21775 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability exists in the way certain events are processed for ImageLoader objects of Webkit WebKitGTK 2.30.4. A specially crafted web page can lead to a potential information leak and further memory corruption. In order to trigger the vulnerability, a victim must be tricked into visiting a malicious webpage.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-21775` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.32.3-1ubuntu1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.32.3-1ubuntu1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-5.0 - 2.32.3-1ubuntu1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.32.3-1ubuntu1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.32.3-1ubuntu1
gir1.2-webkit2-5.0 - 2.32.3-1ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.32.3-1ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.32.3-1ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.32.3-1ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-5.0-0 - 2.32.3-1ubuntu1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.32.3-1ubuntu1
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.32.3-1ubuntu1
libwebkit2gtk-5.0-0 - 2.32.3-1ubuntu1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.32.3-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.32.3-1ubuntu1').
